(a bit off-topic, my apologies)

xin yao is one of my lecturers here at birmingham :)

he is a very good speaker. i say that he's my lecturer; unfortunately 
after the first two weeks he got someone else to cover the rest of the 
lectures this term (Yong Liu, who despite being the co-creator of 
negative correlation learning, and quite a brilliant and nice guy, is 
not a particularly good lecturer.)

i see this is why my coursemate (whose project Xin is supervising) can 
never see him, since he's off wasting time at these stupid conferences 
in america :)

by the way, if any of you are looking for an MSc programme, mine so far 
has been excellent - it has been a very good overview of evolutionary 
computation, neural computation, nature inspired optimisation, etc. a 
large portion of the faculty here is involved in naturally inspired 
methods including neuroevolution, and it has been very intellectually 
stimulating.

-KB-

Kenneth Stanley wrote:
> Yeah the guy giving the NN tutorial is Xin Yao, who is famous for his
> 1999 pre-NEAT paper on neuroevolution, "Evolving Neural Networks,"
> which was and probably still is the most comprehensive review of the
> field.  But unfortunately at least in past years it looks like his
> tutorial is mostly from that era, so it's missing a lot of the recent
> developments in the field like NEAT.  (Of course this year could be
> different.)  Still, I recommend checking it out since he's a well
> known researcher and his perspective may be useful.

--
